    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Balisse (Confessor Angel)</h1>Balisses, or confessor angels, seek to assist mortals ensnared by moral dilemmas or crises of faith. Balisses prefer to guide people to their own decisions rather than demand obedience to a higher cause, as intrinsic belief is even more powerful than blind obedience. While most balisses are fundamentally honest, they use their guardian angel ability to seem less intimidating and decrease the chance the mortal will simply acquiesce to the opinion of an obviously divine being. Balisses often form from souls of those who performed evil acts but were redeemed. Many serve the goddess Sarenrae, but they can serve other good deities and empyreal lords as well.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Celestial</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 24<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=15">Balisse</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 8</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Angel_Balisse.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Angel_Balisse.png"></a><span alt="Neutral Good" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Good">NG</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Angel Trait" class="trait" title="This family of celestials is native to the plane of Nirvana. Most angels are neutral good, have darkvision, and have a weakness to evil damage."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=8">Angel</a></span><span alt="Celestial Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the good-aligned planes are called celestials. Celestials can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=23">Celestial</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 18</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +18; (+20 to detect lies and illusions); darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=16"><u>Celestial</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>; <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=340"><i>tongues</i></a><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +14, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +17, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +18<br /><b>Str</b> +5, <b>Dex</b> +2, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> +1, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +5<br /><b>Items</b> <i>+1 <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=280">striking</a> <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=38">scimitar</a></i><hr /><b>AC</b> 26, <b>Fort</b> +16, <b>Ref</b> +12, <b>Will</b> +18; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 145; <b>Resistances</b> fire 15; <b>Weaknesses</b> evil 10<br /><b>Confessor’s Aura</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>) 20 feet. Creatures in the balisse’s aura are subject to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=379"><i>zone of truth</i></a> (DC 23). Additionally, if these creatures choose to honestly express their own conflicted feelings, the aura makes it easier for them to put words to those feelings.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 30 feet, fly 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>flaming scimitar</i> +20 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=72"><u>fire</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=180"><u>forceful</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=83"><u>good</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d6+8 slashing plus 1d6 fire and 1d6 good</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 26; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=86">divine wrath</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=148">heal</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=213">paralyze</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=250">remove curse</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=251">remove disease</a></u></i>; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=252">remove fear</a></u></i> (at will); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (at will, self only); <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=65">detect alignment</a></u></i> (at will, evil only)<br /><b>Divine Rituals</b> DC 26; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=2">atone</a></u></i>; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=12">geas</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Rituals.aspx?ID=22">angelic messenger</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Brand of the Impenitent</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=38"><u>curse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>) <b>Frequency</b> once per day; <b>Effect</b> The balisse marks an evil creature within its confessor’s aura as irredeemable. It can only do so after a failed attempt to convince the creature to repent. The touched creature takes a –1 status penalty to AC and saves, reduces its resistances by 2, and gains weakness 2 to good damage. The duration depends on the target’s DC 26 Will save.<br /> <b>Critical Success</b> The creature is unaffected.<br /> <b>Success</b> The duration is 1 round.<br /> <b>Failure</b> The duration is 1 day.<br /> <b>Critical Failure</b> The duration is permanent.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Flaming Armament</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>) Any weapon gains the effect of a <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=295">flaming</a> property rune while a balisse wields it.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Guiding Angel</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) While invisible, a balisse can spiritually attach itself to a non-evil mortal. When it does so, it merges with the mortal’s body and is unable to use any of its spells and abilities other than to interact with the mortal. It must use Guiding Angel again to leave the mortal. While merged with the mortal, the balisse can take a form of its choice that only the mortal can see, such as a small angel on the mortal’s shoulder. Alternatively, it can communicate with the mortal using a bodiless voice only the mortal can hear.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=3">Angel</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=16">Astral Deva (Emissary Angel)</a></td><td>14</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=15">Balisse (Confessor Angel)</a></td><td>8</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=13">Cassisian (Archive Angel)</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=14">Choral (Choir Angel)</a></td><td>6</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=3">Angel</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 16</i></a><br />The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. The majority of angels are neutral good and live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. However, some angels, including several angelic deities, have different alignments, and some even dwell on other planes. Regardless of alignment, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Angelic Divinities</h3>The most powerful angels belong to a category of demigods known as the empyreal lords—a title shared with other powerful good-aligned demigods among the host of archons, azatas, and other inhabitants of the celestial planes. The most powerful and most well-known of the angelic empyreal lords is Sarenrae.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Angelic Locations</h3>Angels normally live on Nirvana or other celestial planes, but their missions can bring them to the Material Plane. Spellcasters can conjure them for aid or advice in times of need, and they can even be found, if rarely, crusading against fiends in Hell, the Abyss, or anywhere in between.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Angelic Treasure</h3>Many angels wear exquisite armor or wield beautiful and often magical weapons. While they are not hampered by mortal sins like greed or pride (save for the very rare and tragic exception), they do enjoy the beauty of fine clothing, exquisite jewelry, and works of art.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Angels</h3>The most powerful angels are known as the solars, but numerous others can be found in Nirvana working their own missions or goals. Angels generally appear as beautiful, often somewhat androgynous humanoids, and the most powerful often possess two or even four sets of feathered wings.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
